page.title: 05HOME LIFE
page.content: Families here live much more comfort- ably than they did a generation ago. A number of homes have central heating but many retain open coal fires, some still cooking on combination ranges. Electricity, Calor (not North Sea) gas and oil are also used for cooking and heating. Apart from a few outlying dwellings,all houses have electric light. Most have bathrooms, though some still have outside toilets. Nearly all homes have television and washing machines and many have refrigerators and freezers. Most fam- ilies still dry their clothes outside. Home baking is general and jam and wine are also made at home. Houses are comfortably furnished, often with fitted carpets, though prodded mats and hooky rugs are still to be found. Most households have a dog, a cat or both.
